properties.areaDesc: Sandia/Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 10 at 3:38AM MST until February 10 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW OVER PORTIONS OF WESTERN AND CENTRAL
NEW MEXICO HIGH TERRAIN THROUGH THIS MORNING...

...COLDER TEMPERATURES, MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW, AND WINDY
CONDITIONS TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...

.Light to occasionally moderate snow will continue through this
morning across the high terrain of central and western New Mexico.
Areas most likely to observe accumulations will be found along
the central mountain chain. A brief break in the wintry weather is
then expected this afternoon, however a more significant winter
storm will move over New Mexico tonight through Tuesday night when
many areas of northern and central New Mexico can expect moderate
to heavy snowfall and colder temperatures. In addition, periods
of strong and gusty winds will create areas of blowing snow in
central New Mexico. Residents and travelers through much of
northern and central New Mexico can expect significant travel
impacts tonight through Tuesday night.

* WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total
snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as
45 mph across the Sandia and Manzano Mountains late tonight
through Tuesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow will
continue. Additional snow accumulations of one or two inches.

* WHERE...Tusas Mountains Including Chama, Sandia and Manzano
Mountains including Edgewood.

* WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 5 PM this afternoon
to 11 PM MST Tuesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until
noon MST today.

* IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions are possible for the
morning commute this morning. Travel conditions will
deteriorate further tonight into Tuesday and could be very
difficult to impossible.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST TODAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 PM MST TUESDAY
